results.title: Homes from home: caring for children
results.creator_credit: Gordon Croton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Documentary series aimed at social workers. This episode deals with the caring of children in institutions prior to them either going back to their family homes or into foster care.

results.title: Homeostasis
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: biology”.
Homeostasis explores the internal systems of balance and regulation in animals. With the assistance of computer animation, sequences illustrate how the body deals with stress and copes with changing conditions such as high and low temperatures, and how the shortage or excess of fluids is adjusted and regulated. Six 10 minute episodes present students at secondary and post secondary levels with a comprehensible definition of homeostasis with examples of how it works, and how this on-going balancing of internal conditions to external changes and stimuli is triggered and monitored. Includes: 1. “Coping with change”, 2. “The Sea within”, 3. “Osmoregulation”, 4. ” The Feedback cycle”, 5. “Biochemical balances”, 6. “Hormonal control.”

results.title: Homelands
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Maria and Carlos are a Salvadorean couple living in Melbourne, refugees from the coup d’etat of 1979 and the subsequent civil war. Like many refugees, when peace returns to their home country, they are caught in the dilemma of deciding where they want to live and where they ultimately belong. Carlos chooses to go back immediately to help rebuild his country. Maria and their four children decide to remain in Australia. Six months later, Maria decides to re-visit El Salvador, both to find Carlos and to confront her past. Zubrycki’s closeness to the family, developed over the course of the year he spent filming them, results in an unusually intimate portrayal of domestic tensions.

results.title: Homecraft in Sweden
results.brief_description: Describes the many aspects of handicrafts in Sweden and shows how these have strong roots in the traditions of the ocuntry. Amongst the handicrafts shown are: upholstery making, carpet making, lace making, weaving, basket making, knitting, iron work, and pottery. Describes the techniques used in these crafts and shows numerous examples of the quality of the work produced.

results.title: Home to the sea
results.creator_credit: Boris Holtzman and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Examines rights of passage, fishing and mineral concessions, and the kinds of ecological safeguards needed to assure that the natural resources of the sea will be protected from exploitation by selfish national interests.

results.title: Home sweet home
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the organisation and effort required to reconstruct Darwin after it had been destroyed by Cyclone Tracy on Christmas Day, 1974. Illustrates the social impact of the cyclone.

results.title: Home safe home
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill, Charles Cahill and Associates and Macko Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety”.
Shows basic concepts of home safety to elementary students. Major areas covered include: fire, electricity, poisons, slip and falls, cuts and bruises.

results.title: Home of the Kodavas
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Life in the little known state of Coorg in South India. The martial Kodavas, their quaint customs and simple pleasures. Coorg, nestling in a chain of hills, abounds in fertile fields and luxuriant jungles. A land of streams and rivers, including Kaveri the sacred river of the south.
